image.altText: Bradley John Murdoch

props.synopsis: Bradley Murdoch spent the rest of his life in prison after being convicted of murdering British backpacker Peter Falconio. Those who knew him behind bars say he was a "lone wolf" and a master manipulator, who was uncooperative until the end.

title.children: Inmates and guards shed light on the real Bradley Murdoch behind bars

image.altText: Aircraft sit at the gates of Darwin International Airport.

props.synopsis: The operators of Darwin's airport have raised its landing fees by more than 110 per cent, with some airlines already increasing passenger ticket prices in response.

title.children: Darwin airport hikes fees to 'more than double' anywhere else in Australia

image.altText: A woman in a police uniform, leaving against a wooden edge.

props.synopsis: A sergeant who responded to the "bizarre" dead-of-night call about Peter Falconio and Joanne Lees being ambushed in remote NT has spoken exclusively with the ABC, saying she had no idea how much global attention the case would attract at the time.

title.children: First cop on scene of Falconio case recalls 'bizarre' tip-off from truckie

image.altText: Australian Army Helicopter

props.synopsis: An Australian Army helicopter participating in the multinational Talisman Sabre exercise in the Northern Territory has been damaged in a "hard landing".

title.children: Australian Army helicopter damaged in 'hard landing' during war drills

image.altText: View of mountains in a golden yellow colour, hazy sky in the horizon.

props.synopsis: Northern Territory Parks is reminding hikers to carry personal location devices and be well prepared when they head into the outback.

title.children: Larapinta Trail hikers urged caution after two rescues in one week

image.altText: Old photo of soldier standing beside crashed fighter plane in flames

props.synopsis: Eighty years since Allied victory in the Pacific, a historian discovers new evidence of wartime espionage, including reports of spies posing as swagmen.

title.children: Historian uncovers eyewitness stories of parachute drops of WWII spies

image.altText: An Aboriginal women accepts a medal from the Governor-General, with an image of Yunupingu displayed prominently behind her.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's most influential Aboriginal leaders has posthumously received the nation's highest civilian honour.

title.children: Dr Yunupiŋu posthumously awarded Australia's highest civilian honour

image.altText: Stephen Colbert and Jimmy Kimmel, both wearing dark suits, shake hands and smile on the set of a late night show

props.synopsis: Late-night talk show hosts rally around Stephen Colbert following the announcement that his show won't return after 2026, with US President Donald Trump writing on social media: "Kimmel is next."

title.children: 'Kimmel is next': Trump reacts to Colbert cancellation, hosts rally around star

image.altText: Ominous rain clouds gather over Victoria's Kangaroo Ground

props.synopsis: Despite hopeful forecasts in autumn, widespread rains have so far failed to materialise across much of southern Australia. But there is hope on the horizon.

title.children: Widespread winter rains on the horizon to end July

image.altText: James Sicily argues with Ollie Lord

props.synopsis: Hawthorn and Port Adelaide have quickly become fierce rivals over the last 12 months, with Tasmania hosting the latest clash between the two. Follow the action in our live blog.

title.children: Howling winds cause havoc as Hawks and Power take rivalry to Tassie

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Hawks and Power lock horns at York Park
No late changes for Hawks or Power

image.altText: A democracy sausage sits in white bread held by a paper napkin.

props.synopsis: Polling booths are officially open for the Tasmanian state election, barely a year after they closed last time. Here is everything you need to know.

title.children: Tasmania's early election has arrived. Here's what you need to know

image.altText: A man in a black t-shirt holds a Druze flag in his left hand as he looks into the camera under a dark night sky.

props.synopsis: When the Israel-Syria border was breached, heartwarming family reunions decades in the making ensued for a number of hours, on both sides of the fence. But the happiness was still tempered by fear over the conflict.

title.children: This gate had been off limits for decades, then Israel seized an opportunity

image.altText: Paige Bueckers dribbles the basketball with her right hand

props.synopsis: The pay dispute between the WNBA and its players continues to be the elephant in the room as the league celebrates its All-Star weekend.

title.children: Star rookie lashes 'disrespectful' WNBA proposal amid bitter pay dispute

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, centre, celebrates his election win with his partner Jodie Haydon (R) and Labor senate leader Penny Wong (L).

props.synopsis: The public service briefs prepared for ministers in the returned Albanese government are heavily redacted, but still offer some interesting insights into the challenges it faces.

title.children: 'Difficult few years': What the public service just told its new ministers

image.altText: East Antarctica

props.synopsis: Scientists aim to unlock insights into the Earth's climate evolution after recovering ice core in Antarctica.

title.children: World's oldest ice could unlock 'completely unknown' climate history

image.altText: Children running onto the beach

props.synopsis: DPR Korea Tour, a website operated by North Korea's tourism authority, says the Wonsan-Kalma coastal resort is "temporarily not receiving foreign tourists".

title.children: North Korea bans foreign tourists to newly opened beach resort

image.altText: Mr Skaik sitting on an upright piano in Preston Markets smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Five months after fleeing his home in Gaza, Baher Skaik sat behind a piano in Melbourne's Preston Markets. He was there to play for strangers as part of the ABC series The Piano. It brought unexpected and life-changing rewards for his young family.

title.children: Baher moved a market to tears and sealed a new future for his family

image.altText: Jair Bolsonaro sitting in a maroon leather back seat of a car wearing a black jacket and jeans while photographers stand outside

props.synopsis: Jair Bolsonaro is accused of seeking to nullify President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva's 2022 election win, and has been ordered to wear an electronic ankle bracelet, not leave his home at night, or use social media.

title.children: Police raid ex-Brazilian president's home amid alleged coup attempt trial

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Mark Carney shake hands.

props.synopsis: When Canada and Australia experienced similar election results, the impact of the Trump effect became clearer, along with its potential to shift future alliances.

title.children: The 'Trump effect' could mean an alliance shift that excludes the US

image.altText: Two dolphins leaping out of the water

props.synopsis: Inside one of the world's only city-based dolphin sanctuary, the pod population has halved since becoming protected and experts fear some of their biggest challenges are ahead.

title.children: Dolphins in Australia's only city-based sanctuary still in need of protection

image.altText: Mark Latham wearing a suit and tie stands in front of an australian flag

props.synopsis: As calls grow for parliament to take action against Mark Latham, University of Sydney professor of constitutional law Anne Twomey says there are limits on what parliament could do, even if the allegations are proven.

title.children: 'People elected him': Why Latham is likely to remain in NSW parliament

image.altText: Two people looking at the camera and smiling

props.synopsis: The siblings who discovered the body of Rosemary Brown 25 years ago have spoken for the first time, as police renew the search for her missing daughter Melissa Trussell.

title.children: Children linked to 25-year cold case speak for the first time

image.altText: A woman in a black one piece swim suit sits beside a pool block and smiles.

props.synopsis: In the last 12 months, teen Ellie Cole has competed at an Olympics and a World Cup, and won a national title. She's now at the World Championships, and tells us the biggest thing she's learnt so far.

title.children: Diver Ellie Cole on chasing perfection, impostor syndrome and a year of learning

image.altText: David Johnston Talisman Sabre

props.synopsis: As AUKUS looms, Admiral David Johnston told the ABC his organisation needs to manage money better.

title.children: Defence must get better at managing big, expensive projects, chief says

image.altText: Skiers stand next to a sign in the snow.

props.synopsis: Visits to Aussie ski resorts dropped by nearly 30 per cent since the pandemic with the expense putting it out of reach for many. But here's some tips on how to do it without breaking the bank.

title.children: Is skiing overseas really cheaper? The Japan vs Aussie alps showdown

image.altText: a man in hoodie on computer as woman walks past.

props.synopsis: South Korea's new government faces pressure from both sides: young women demanding systemic reform, and disaffected young men resentful over perceived "reverse discrimination," expressing growing resentment over issues like military service and job insecurity.

title.children: Deepfake porn and pay gaps: South Korean women have had enough

image.altText: A fan of British and Irish Lions waves a flag whilst wearing a lions mask

props.synopsis: Twelve years of anticipation will end on Saturday night when the Wallabies and British and Irish Lions face off in the first of three Test matches. Here is what you need to know about the first Test between the Wallabies and the British and Irish Lions.

title.children: Lions vs Wallabies: How to watch, when is kick-off and who is playing?

image.altText: A group of Adelaide Crows and Port Adelaide AFL players run through a single banner - it reads "Vale Phil Walsh 1960-2015".

props.synopsis: The tragic death of Crows coach Phil Walsh stunned the football world and united the two halves of Adelaide — two weeks later, Adelaide met Port Adelaide in a game like no other. On the 10th anniversary, Andrew McGarry looks back at Showdown 39.

title.children: 'In darkness I leave': The hope and heartbreak from the Phil Walsh Showdown

image.altText: An army tank firing flames.

props.synopsis: The decision to gift the tanks to Ukraine's war effort encountered "logistics challenges" in its path to fruition, but more than half of the tanks have now arrived.

title.children: Australia's Abrams tanks reach Ukraine after nine months

image.altText: Tim Tszyu sits on the ring apron talking to journalists

props.synopsis: Tim Tszyu tells ABC Sport he is focused "on the present" as he prepares to step back in the ring with Sebastian Fundora, who he lost his WBO super welterweight world title to last March.

title.children: Tszyu ready to 'prove to everyone exactly who I really am' in Fundora rematch

image.altText: Luke Plapp reacts after crossing the finish line

props.synopsis: Australia's Luke Plapp briefly leads the gruelling 10.9km uphill slog at the Tour de France before becoming one of several challengers to be eclipsed by the prolific Tadej Pogačar.

title.children: Aussie's brilliant climb eclipsed as Pogačar continues Tour dominance

image.altText: Marc Leishman swings the golf club

props.synopsis: Marc Leishman and Adam Scott have contrasting fortunes at the British Open heading into the weekend as world number one Scottie Scheffler tops the leaderboard.

title.children: Leishman shrugs off Open frustrations as nightmare round dooms Scott

image.altText: A smiling large man in black jacket, light pants next to smiling, older, trim man holds a hose, next to grey holden.

props.synopsis: Malcom Harris had only just learnt CPR when he used it to save a man's life in the 1980s. Four decades later, during a routine trip to the car wash, the 94-year-old retiree was the one who needed saving.

title.children: Fisherman uses 30 years of CPR training to save life at car wash

image.altText: A road sign reading "Mackay Ring Road Sarina"

props.synopsis: Police allege the car collided with a ute after attempting to overtake a semi-trailer on Mackay Ring Road in Glenella about 10:30pm on Saturday.

title.children: Three people killed in north Queensland car crash

image.altText: Hannah sitting in the sun smiling with a drink in hand.

props.synopsis: The ex-partner of a Victorian woman tells a Supreme Court trial that he is guilty of her murder, prompting cheers from her friends and family as he is led from the court.

title.children: In shock move, Lachlan Young pleads guilty to murder of Hannah McGuire
